metadata.subject: Hess Corp. | Inflection point: adding Hess to BofAML’s US 1 ‘best ideas’ list
metadata.sender: Doug Leggate, Kalei Akamine, John H. Abbott (BofA Merrill Lynch Research Analysts)

organizations: U.S. House Committee on Oversight and Accountability

relationships.description: BofA Merrill Lynch provides research coverage and investment analysis for Hess Corp
Hess is a partner with ExxonMobil in Guyana oil exploration projects
Lead research analyst covering Hess Corp for BofA Merrill Lynch

analysis.purpose: Investment recommendation to add Hess Corp to BofAML's US 1 'best ideas' list based on expected inflection point in performance
analysis.significance: Research report recommending significant investment in Hess Corp based on projected turnaround and Guyana oil discovery potential

notable_quotes: We thus would view Hess as a dangerous 'short' for investors seeking to hedge other portfolio risks.
We believe Hess' investment case is approaching an inflection point on multiple levels.
Under our base case, which assumes a rebound in oil prices towards $70 from 2020 fair value is reasonably ~$80 per share.

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this financial research report

illegal_activity.description: Standard financial research report with no illegal activity discussed

public_knowledge.context: Standard equity research report that would be distributed to institutional clients and potentially covered by financial media

analysis.summary: BofA Merrill Lynch research report recommending Hess Corp as a Buy rating with $80 price target, highlighting an expected inflection point in production and free cash flow driven by Guyana oil discoveries and Bakken asset recovery, while replacing Devon Energy on the firm's US 1 'best ideas' list.
